newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean won ends year-low on rising import deals.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean won ends year-low on rising import deals.

text.p: The won closed at a year low on Friday despite early central bank intervention due to rising importer settlements and dollar position build-ups, dealers said.
"In the final 10 minutes of trading, dollar demand soared because there were no further intervention by the Bank of Korea," said a dealer with a foreign bank.
The won closed at a new year low of 824.00 after moving in a 821.90-825.00 range. It opened at 823.40.
Dealers said the dollar would rise further on Monday on the back of importer settlements.
"The dollar is likely to test the 826.00 level on Monday. But fears of central bank intervention will depress trading," said a dealer with a domestic bank.
Dealers said the central bank intervened to support the won when the won/dollar rate hit the 823.50 level in the morning.
The bank has never admitted intervening in the market.
Dealers forecast trading would range from 822.70/823.00 to 826.00 on Monday.
